qas.question: What infamous event occurred during Bateman's term as president?
What was the name of the event the athletic program was involved with prior to the Mountain West Conference?
In what year did the school begin a BYU television network?
What type of BYU TV network opened in 2000 under Pres. Merrill J. Bateman?
What did Pres. Bateman replace a scheduled devotial to do following the Sept. 11th, 2001 attacks?

answers.text: led the student body in a prayer for peace

qas.question: What library was Pres. Bateman responsible for expanding?
What did BYU's athletic program join under Pres. Bateman?
Which did BYU's athletic program belong to before joining the Mountain West Conference?
Who was responsible for building 63 new buildings for the university?
Who was one of the leaders who brought about the creation of the West Mountain Conference?
What program joined the West Mountain Conference?
What type of TV network opened in 2001?

context: <b9_0><b10_0>Bateman<b10_0/><b9_0/> was responsible for the building of 36 new buildings for the university both on and off campus, including the expansion of the <a6_0>Harold B. Lee Library<a6_0/>. He was also one of several key college leaders who brought about the creation of <a7_0>the Mountain West Conference<a7_0/>, which <b11_0>BYU's athletics program<b11_0/> joined — BYU previously participated in <a1_0><a8_0>the Western Athletic Conference<a8_0/><a1_0/>. A BYU <a4_0><b12_0>satellite<b12_0/><a4_0/> TV network also opened in <a2_0>2000<a2_0/> under his leadership. Bateman was also president during <a0_0>the September 11th attacks<a0_0/> in 2001. The planes crashed on a Tuesday, hours before the weekly devotional normally held at BYU. Previous plans for the devotional were altered, as Bateman <a5_0>led the student body in a prayer for peace<a5_0/>. Bateman was followed by <b13_0>Cecil O. Samuelson<b13_0/> in 2003. Samuelson was succeeded by <a3_0>Kevin J Worthen<a3_0/> in 2014.
